xldoc.title: An Analytic History of Philosophical Logic
xldoc.description: A history of logic and of the concept of logical truth
xldoc.keywords: rbjones philosophy analytic semantics meaning necessity logic metaphysics

section.title: Overview
section.abstract: A history of logic from a philosophical standpoint, with particular emphasis on the evolution of the concept of logical truth.

section.title: Background
section.abstract: A few words on the purposes and character of the proposed history.

subsec.title: Purpose and Character
subsec.p: This is not intended as a comprehensive scholarly history of philosophical logic. It is intended to play a role in the development and exposition of Metphysical Positivism a contemporary positivistic philosophical system.

A central feature of Metaphysical Positivism is a method of logical analysis, and the philosophical rationale for its application in philosophy and elsewhere.. The role of this analytic history of philosophical logic is to trace the history of the key elements of the philosophical and technical basis for this method, and to do so in a manner consistent with the proposed analytic method, provided an extended exemplar of the method.

subsec.title: The Method of Formal Logical Analysis
subsec.p: The backbone of this analytic history will be a series of formal models of various aspects of the history of philosophical logic, semantics and metaphysics, all undertaken by a single formal method.
It will therefore begin with an exposition of this method, together with some material about the significance of semantics, and the application of the method to metaphysics.
Those aspects of the history which underpin this method will be emphasised, providing a 2500 year history of the developments which culminated in the adopted method.

subsec.title: Metaphysical Positivism
subsec.p: This work is being undertaken in tandem with a much smaller informal volume promulgating a new generation of positivistic phlosophy and entitled "metaphysical positivism", a key feature of which is the reconciliation of some of the more benign features of positivist thought with a positive attitude towards metaphysics.

This explains the particular place in the proposed history of metaphysics, and the importance attached to the central notion of "logical truth" and its various correlates such as logical necessity, and the interest in semantics and analyiticity.

section.title: Part III - Theory Listings
section.abstract: A condensation of the formal backbone to the analytical history, presenting the naked analytic truths obtained by formal deduction.

subsec.title: Ultimately
subsec.p: This will be, in the final work, a separate volume comprising complete listings of all the formal theories developed in the first two parts, and of any previoualy developed theories upon which the work depends. These will be fully indexed to facilitate reference.

It will provide a listing of all the definitively proven results, which will constitute exclusively analytic propositions for which formal demonstrations will have been constructed and computer checked. Each theory listing will include the definitions which establish the logical context for the derivations.
This part will also provide complete definitions of the logic in which the work has been done, either explicitly or by reference.

subsec.title: En Passant
subsec.p: Publication, all being well, will be in stages, even though all parts of the work will be progressed in concert.

The first edition of the first part will include the listing of the theories belonging to that part, as will the first edition of the second volume. Once both volumes have been published the theory listings will then be combined into a third volume and will be removed from the first two parts.
Publication will be as "Print on Demand" through Amazon's CreateSpace subsidiary.
